title: Stolen 2 x TOP condition Bays stolen in 4 DAYS London *PICS*

posts.content:
Not pre67 sorry, but needs posting, 2 superb Bays have been stolen from drive and road in the last 4 days, south London and Orpington ( inside M25) must be professional thieves as they are stealing quality vans. The 1st van is a very late Bay V reg, far less of these around.

Please feel free to copy and post on any other uk vw forums you use.

DONT LEAVE OLD VWS ON YOUR DRIVE OR IN ROAD PERMANENTLY, especially around London, keep moving them to different locations if you really have too or block them tightly in on your drive overnight by other large cars or if storing on drive, leave them up on axle stands and remove 2 wheels and store these away from van.
I hope these people get their vans back.

Van 1 :

Hi Owen
Just putting the word out that Dads van was stolen this morning !! if
you could send this mail on to any one in the VW scene that you know
we would appreciate you spreading the word to help get it back.It was
taken off his drive between the hours of 11pm and 6am this morning
(19th April) in Orpington, Kent.
Thanks Scott






Van 2 :

Hi There,

Unfortunately I have to report that I had my van stolen 1 night ago. The van was stolen overnight on wednesday 15th-thursday 16th April from outside my flat in honor oak park south london. Chassis
Number: 2332109891, Engine Number: AS 182193.

I've included pics.

I really hate the people who took her from me. I just had my first trip of the year down to devon and it was awesome. A day later the van is stolen by some scumbags who donâ€™t want to work hard and save money to pay for a van as I did.

Anyway I would appreciate it very much if you could keep your eyes peeled. I realise though that this is probably a professional job and I am unlikely to see the van again. If nothing else this is a reminder that there are some horrible people out there so keep your van safe and sound.

Cheers

Steve

author.location: Zummerset.. Land of Cider, Combines & Campers

posts.content: Bad Times...
sad days....................hope they get recovered!

Just got an email via T2OC and saw on their forum info about the green bay that was stolen and came on to the SSVC site to post only to find it had already been done!!
Hope these are found soon.

Terry

That's really sad news!

Hope they get them back ASAP.

I wonder who the hell has the bloody cheek to do this! It's not as though they are that small or easy to steal!

Fingers crossed

flip

Nasty nasty Hope the owners of both vans get them back.

It worries me how easy it might be to sell these vans on to some unsuspecting buyer

They are easy to steal and very easy to ring so unsuspecting buyers will be fine as no one will tell ! due to the prices of these vans they have become a big target
I think the moral here is Fit a Tracker regardless of cost in fact a tracker should be at the top of everyones list way before anything else
maybee there could be a forum bulk buy

Really really hope these busses get returned to their rightful owners they are like family members to most people

theiving scum live all around us im affraid

It really makes you think about what you'd do if it happened to you......

We will be looking our for your buses. Hope you get them back - devastating.

We had a Tracker fitted and couldn't get insurance through Footman James as it wasn't factory fitting.

Explain that!!! We expected it to be a bonus
